>
> Doran is stupid though.

Unfortunately I agree.

Doran got many changes throughs the ages. 
However, some always remained not enough or too powerful.


The OP idea is not stupid but in fact it is.

If you chose AD or AP version, with lifesteal, mana or health regeneration, it still remain in chosing different items, like now.

Actually, I was suggesting the idea as a joke due to the fact that the "Doran's" items usually show whether you are building AD or AP (or going tanky), but there's never any in-game explanation of who Doran is and why he made items commonly used in the beginning of League matches.

You guys, read the Journal of Justice.
They explain who Doran is and why his items are terrible/first buy.

He was a young genius item crafter, who, on his way to the Institute of War broke a wheel on his cart.
When he stopped to fix it, his horse kicked him in the head. He had severe brain damage but was allowed to continue crafting out of pity. Now he just makes a bunch of small, weak items.

Doran was a prodigy weaponsmith. He made some of the finest weapons in all the land. Then he got kicked in the head by a mule, and became derped. The league took pity on him,  and let him make simple items so he could still do what he loves. It's explained in the backstory stuff, like everything else.

> Jax can be a hybrid, but he isn't effective as one.  Hybrid itemization isn't great

He *does* hybrid damage. It is obviously not best to *build* him with a bunch of hybrid items, because he depends on attack speed so much. W and ult procs add up a LOT.

A Red made a comment about how either Hybrid items or Hybrid champions have to be pretty much undertuned because if both are tuned close to standard power levels, then they will get huge power spikes every item they pick up.
